title: Travel and tourism industry expects continued thrust from government in Budget to boost growth
author: Zoya Springwala
content:
The $22 billion Indian tourism market is expected to continue along its growth momentum, likely to surge to $34.1 billion by 2029. The tourism industry is expecting a slew of measures from the upcoming Union Budget, including hopes of the government extending its thrust on boosting domestic tourism.

The country’s travel and tourism industry contributes roughly 10 percent to the GDP. Over the next few years, until 2029, the industry will likely attract 31 million travellers and create 53 million jobs. Some of the key listed tourism players areITC HotelsandThe Indian Hotels Companybeing the among the key market leaders.
